intro: Oxylobium sericeum, commonly known as the silky oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Oxylobium sericeum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
